description: Deloris Wilson (Deloris Van Cartier) is a lounge singer in Reno, Nevada, in a club owned by her married gangster boyfriend Vince LaRocca.
Deloris witnesses a crime committed by Vince LaRocca and is placed in witness protection. She is relocated to a convent in San Francisco, where she must pose as a nun.
Deloris struggles to adapt to life in the convent and clashes with the strict Mother Superior. She also finds it difficult to fit in with the other nuns.
Sister Mary Patrick offers kindness to Deloris when she first arrives by offering her friendship and support.
Deloris discovers the convent's choir, which is in disarray, and decides to take charge and revitalize it using her musical talents.
Deloris tries to sneak out of the convent to perform at a nightclub, but is caught by Mother Superior. This leads to a confrontation where Deloris expresses her desire to help the choir.
Deloris successfully revitalizes the choir, bringing new energy and attracting attention to the convent.
The choir's success helps to improve the convent's reputation and brings the community together.
Deloris faces challenges as she balances her new life in the convent with her past, but she remains determined to keep the choir thriving.
The choir prepares for a big performance that could secure the future of the convent.
The big performance takes place, showcasing the choir's talent and bringing hope to the convent.
Deloris's past catches up with her, putting the convent and choir in danger.
Deloris and the nuns work together to protect the convent and ensure the choir's future.
The convent faces a crisis as authorities investigate the threats against it.
Deloris and the nuns rally the community to support the convent and its mission.
The community comes together to support the convent, strengthening its resolve.
Deloris and the nuns prepare for the final challenges ahead, united and hopeful.
The story concludes with the convent and choir overcoming their challenges, celebrating their unity and success.
